abstract.text: A request to send a message to the designated recipients.

inlineContent.text: object when the user asks to send a message to one or more users. This intent object contains the message to send and the recipients of the message, which can include groups of users. Use the information in this object to construct and send the message.

abstract.text: The ability for Siri to automatically read out messages over AirPods.
An option that grants Siri permission to read incoming messages out loud when the user has a compatible audio output device connected.
Requests a person’s authorization to allow local and remote notifications for your app.
Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.
A request to fulfill in your app or Intents extension.
The format of the message.
A request to list the messages that match the specified criteria.
A file to include in a message.
A request to send a message to the designated recipients.
Audio files to include in the message.
The content of the message.
The identifier for the conversation.
The name of the group to receive the message.

The format of the message contents.
The array of users to receive the message.
The person or account that’s sending the message.

An interface to handle sending messages to one or more designated users.
Your app’s response to a send message intent.
Provide SiriKit with an intent handler capable of handling a specific intent.
Donate app-specific content, use Siri’s contact suggestions, and adopt the latest platform features to create a more consistent messaging experience.

abstract.text: A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A protocol the system uses to provide context relevant to user notifications.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
